Just as an idea of how long unit tests should take: the project I am
currently on has almost 1200 unit tests that run every time we run
AllTests (which is almost every time we run tests at all) and it takes
around 580 seconds.  Some of these are actually quick
functional/acceptance tests which are testing the object interaction. 
So, with those few taken out (about 10 - 15), our tests take under 2
minutes.

Summary: 2 minutes for somewhere around 1185 tests.

=jason

On Wed, 2002-12-04 at 17:32, J. B. Rainsberger wrote: So said  h3vj  on 
12/4/2002 

>Hi Friends,
>
>I have JUnit tests suite out of which some suites take about 10 - 15 
>minutes to run and some take 1 -2 minutes to run.

To better answer your question, what is causing these tests to take so
long. What external resources do they talk to? Are they blocking on
something?

Perhaps it's not the tests you should change, but the integration
between components involved in the test. When tests take too long to
execute, that often indicates a performance problem you'll encounter in
production. You'd better deal with it now while it's still a
manageable, low-pressure job.

J. B. Rainsberger,
